sen.j: 天かす（てんかす、天カス、天滓とも書く）とは、天ぷらを揚げる時に副産物として生じる揚げかすのことである。
sen.e: Tenkasu (天かす, also written as てんかす, 天カス, 天滓) are small pieces of deep-fried dough produced during cooking tenpura.
Tenkasu (天かす, also written as てんかす, 天カス, 天滓) are small pieces of deep-fried dough produced during cooking tenpura.
Tenkasu (天かす, also written as てんかす, 天カス, 天滓) are small pieces of deep-fried dough produced during cooking tenpura.

sen.j: 揚げ玉（あげだま）とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: They are also referred to as Age-dama.
They are also referred to as Age-dama.
They are also referred to as Age-dama.

sen.j: 天かすには揚げたことによる風味と油のコク、サクサクとした独特の食感があるため、他の料理の添え物やアクセントになる食材として利用される。
sen.e: With its deep-fried flavor, rich taste of the cooking oil, and special crispy touch, tenkasu is used as foodstuff for trimmings or garnishes of various dishes.
With its deep-fried flavor, rich taste of the cooking oil, and special crispy texture, tenkasu is used as foodstuff for trimmings or garnishes of various dishes.
With its deep-fried flavor, rich taste of the cooking oil, and special crispy texture, tenkasu is used as foodstuff for trimmings or garnishes of various dishes.

sen.j: 解説
sen.e: Explanation
Explanation
Explanation

sen.j: 天ぷらを作る時に天ぷらだねにつけた、薄力粉と溶き卵と水からなる液状の衣が、油に入れる際に少量ずつたねから離れる。
sen.e: When frying tempura, the fluid batter of soft flour and beaten egg is removed from tempura ingredients by bits.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When frying tempura, the fluid batter of soft flour and beaten egg is removed from tempura ingredients by bits.
When frying tempura, the fluid batter of soft flour and beaten egg is removed from tempura ingredients by bits.

sen.j: 天かすはそれらが揚がったものである。
sen.e: Tenkasu are these deep-fried bits.
sen.cmt: 主語「天かす」を補いました一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Tenkasu are these deep-fried bits.
Tenkasu are these deep-fried bits.

sen.j: そのまま油に残したまま揚げ続けると、天かすが焦げ油をいためる
sen.e: Keeping frying with tenkasu left in the cooking oil causes deterioration of the oil by the burnt tenkasu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: To continue frying with tenkasu left in the cooking oil causes deterioration of the oil by the burnt tenkasu.
To continue frying with tenkasu left in the cooking oil causes deterioration of the oil by the burnt tenkasu.

sen.j: それ故、揚がった天ぷら本体を油から取り出した後に残った天かすを、金網等を使ってこまめに回収する。
sen.e: Therefore after taking out cooked tempura out of the oil, tenkasu should be frequently collected with a strainer and like that.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処文頭に「それ故」を補いました
sen.e: Therefore after taking cooked tempura out of the oil, tenkasu should be frequently collected with a strainer or the like.
Therefore after taking cooked tempura out of the oil, tenkasu should be frequently collected with a strainer or the like.

sen.j: 天ぷら屋では大量に生じ、店によっては食品廃材としてそのまま処分される場合もある。
sen.e: The tempura restaurants generate large quantities of tenkasu and some restaurants dispose them as food wastes.
Tempura restaurants generate large quantities of tenkasu and some restaurants dispose of them as food wastes.
Tempura restaurants generate large quantities of tenkasu and some restaurants dispose of them as food wastes.

sen.j: そば屋、うどん屋では種物として天ぷらを揚げ天かすが生じる他に、天ぷらの衣のみを揚げ、商品として利用する。
sen.e: At soba (Japanese buckwheat noodle) restaurants and udon (Japanese wheat flour noodle) restaurants, besides from tenkasu generated from tempura, only batter dough is deep fried to be used as a food.
At soba (Japanese buckwheat noodle) restaurants and udon (Japanese wheat flour noodle) restaurants, besides tenkasu generated from tempura, only batter dough is deep fried to be used as a food.
At soba (Japanese buckwheat noodle) restaurants and udon (Japanese wheat flour noodle) restaurants, besides tenkasu generated from tempura, only batter dough is deep fried to be used as a food.

sen.j: すうどん・かけ蕎麦に載せることで、たぬき (麺類)（関東地方）ハイカラうどん（関西地方）となり、醤油出汁に不足している油のコクを安価に加えることができる。
sen.e: Plain udon or soba noodle with tenkasu on it turns tanuki noodle (in the Kanto region) or haikara noodle (in the Kansai region) that enables to add inexpensive rich, oily taste that plain shoyu noodle soup doesn't have sufficiently.
sen.cmt: 「たぬき」「ハイカラ」を文字通り訳すと長い説明が必要となるため単にtanuki、haikara としました。
sen.e: Plain udon or soba noodle with tenkasu on it turns tanuki noodle (in the Kanto region) or haikara noodle (in the Kansai region) that enables addition of inexpensive rich, oily taste that plain shoyu noodle soup doesn't have sufficiently.

Plain udon or soba noodle with tenkasu on it turns tanuki noodle (in the Kanto region) or haikara noodle (in the Kansai region) that enables addition of inexpensive rich, oily taste that plain shoyu noodle soup doesn't have sufficiently.

sen.j: 関西地方を中心に一部のうどん店においては、天かすを容器に入れて客席に出し、好きなだけ添えられるようにしている所もある。
sen.e: At some udon restarurants mainly in the Kansai region, tenkasu in the container is put on the table so that customers can garnish it freely.
At some udon restarurants mainly in the Kansai region, tenkasu in the container is put on the table so that customers can freely use it as garnish.
At some udon restarurants mainly in the Kansai region, tenkasu in the container is put on the table so that customers can freely use it as garnish.

sen.j: 天かすの用途は、お好み焼きなど他の料理にも拡大している。
sen.e: The usage of tenkasu has expanded to other cookings such as okonomiiyaki (Japanese pancake)
The usage of tenkasu has expanded to other dishes such as okonomiiyaki (Japanese pancake)
The usage of tenkasu has expanded to other dishes such as okonomiyaki (Japanese pancake)

sen.j: 天かすは油の酸化がすすみやすいため長期保存に向いていない。
sen.e: Tenkasu is easily-oxidizable, doesn't have good keeping quality.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Tenkasu is easily-oxidizable, and therefore doesn't have good keeping quality.
Tenkasu is easily-oxidizable, and therefore doesn't have good keeping quality.

sen.j: 他方、家庭等で少量使うために天かすだけを作るのは手間だと思われがちである。
sen.e: On the other hand, cooking just small amount of tenkasu for home use can be regarded as time-consuming.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On the other hand, cooking just a small amount of tenkasu for home use can be considered time-consuming.
On the other hand, cooking just a small amount of tenkasu for home use can be considered time-consuming.

sen.j: そうしたことから一定の需要があり、スーパーや、天麩羅屋やそば屋やなど飲食店、総菜店で天かすは商品として製造販売されている。
sen.e: Then, because of the constant demand, tenkasu is made and sold at supermarkets, tenpura or soba restaurants and delicatessens as foodstuff.
Then, because of the constant demand, tenkasu is made and sold at supermarkets, tenpura or soba restaurants, and delicatessens as foodstuff.
Then, because of the constant demand, tenkasu is made and sold at supermarkets, tenpura or soba restaurants, and delicatessens as foodstuff.

sen.j: そもそもかすである天かすの商品としての価値を上げるためか、小エビなど他の細かい具材を混ぜ込んで作られた商品もある。
sen.e: Some tenkasu contain other ingredients such as shrimps to improve the product since tenkasu is originally just a residue.
Some tenkasu contain other ingredients such as shrimp to improve the product, since tenkasu is originally just a residue.
Some tenkasu contain other ingredients such as shrimp to improve the product, since tenkasu is originally just a residue.

sen.j: 「天かす」と「揚げ玉」
sen.e: Tenkasu' and 'Age-dama'
Tenkasu' and 'Age-dama'
Tenkasu' and 'Age-dama'

sen.j: 2003年度にNHK放送文化研究所が行った調査では天かすと呼ぶ人が68％、揚げ玉が29％、揚げかすが16％という分布だった。
sen.e: In 2003, according to the survey by The NHK Broadcasting Culture Research Institute, 68% of those asked called that deep-fried dough bit 'tenkasu' and 16% called it 'age-dama'.
In 2003, according to a survey by The NHK Broadcasting Culture Research Institute, 68% of those asked called that deep-fried dough bit 'tenkasu' and 16% called it 'age-dama'.
In 2003, according to a survey by The NHK Broadcasting Culture Research Institute, 68% of those asked called that deep-fried dough bit 'tenkasu' and 16% called it 'age-dama'.

sen.j: 東海地方を含む西日本では「天かす」と呼ぶ人が全国平均より多く、関東、甲信越、北海道では「揚げ玉」という人が平均より多いという結果が出ている。
sen.e: In western Japan including the Tokai region, the result showed that the number of people who called it as 'tenkasu' exceeded the national average while in the Kanoto, Koshinetsu and Hokkaido region, the number of people who called it as 'age-dama' are larger than the national average.

In western Japan, including the Tokai region, the result showed that the number of people who called it 'tenkasu' exceeded the national average, while in the Kanoto, Koshinetsu, and Hokkaido region, the number of people who called it 'age-dama' are higher than the national average.

In western Japan, including the Tokai region, the result showed that the number of people who called it 'tenkasu' exceeded the national average, while in the Kanoto, Koshinetsu, and Hokkaido region, the number of people who called it 'age-dama' are higher than the national average.

sen.j: これを裏付けるように、関西地方出身者は「揚げ玉」という呼称を用いずに「天かす」と呼ぶが、東京を中心とする関東地方出身者が「天かす」という呼称を用いることはほとんどない。
sen.e: As a supportive proof, people from the Kansai region call it 'tenkasu' instead of 'age-dama' while people from the Kanto region, mainly Tokyo rarely call it 'tenkasu'.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As supportive proof, people from the Kansai region call it 'tenkasu' instead of 'age-dama,' while people from the Kanto region, mainly Tokyo, rarely call it 'tenkasu'.
一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: （「かす」という言葉は「屑」と同義語で「愚劣」を意味したり、あるいは下品であったりするためと思われる）。
sen.e: (it may be because the term 'kasu' is the synonyms for 'waste' signifying 'foolish' or 'impolite')
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: (it may be because the term 'kasu' is a synonym for 'waste,' signifying 'foolish' or 'impolite')
一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: いずれにせよ、全国的には「揚げ玉」も「天かす」も同じ物品をさす.
sen.e: In any case, in the natiowide, 'age-dama' and 'tenkasu' signify the same foodstuff.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In any case, nationwide, 'age-dama' and 'tenkasu' signify the same foodstuff.
一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 食材として用いるため意図的に作ったものを「揚げ玉」とし、副産物として偶発的に作られたものを「天かす」と区別する場合・説も存在する。
sen.e: There are some theories that separate 'age-dama', which is a foodstuff intentionally made, from 'tenkasu', which is an incidental by-products.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There are some theories that separate 'age-dama', which is a foodstuff intentionally made, from 'tenkasu', which is an incidental by-product.
一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: なお、大阪（特に南部から堺、和歌山にかけて）のうどん店で単に「かす」というと、天かすではなく「油かす」（牛脂を絞った残りかすを油で揚げたもの）を指すことがある。
sen.e: By the way, at udon restarurants in Osaka prefecture (especailly from the south of Oaska to Sakai City, Wakayama prefecture), the term just 'kasu' sometimes signify 'oil residue' (deep-fried beeffat bits) instead of deep-fried dough.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: By the way, at udon restarurants in Osaka prefecture (especially from the south of Oaska to Sakai City, Wakayama prefecture), the term just 'kasu' sometimes signify 'oil residue' (deep-fried beef fat bits) instead of deep-fried dough.
一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 省略せず「天かす」と呼ぶ方が誤解を生まずに済む。
sen.e: Therefore, calling it 'tenkasu' in full will avoid misunderstanding.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, calling it 'tenkasu' in full will avoid misunderstanding.
一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 天かす火災
sen.e: Tenkasu fire
Tenkasu fire
Tenkasu fire

sen.j: 天かすを大量に作り余熱を持ったまま一ヶ所に固めてゴミ箱などに放置した場合、一時間以上後に突如出火してしまう場合がある。
sen.e: A mass of deep-fried tenkasu with the remaining heat left in the dumpster can be the cause of the sudden fire in one or more hours.
A mass of deep-fried tenkasu with the remaining heat left in the dumpster can be the cause of sudden fire in one or more hours.
A mass of deep-fried tenkasu with the remaining heat left in the dumpster can be the cause of sudden fire in one or more hours.

sen.j: 周囲が無人の場合火災に直結し、これは天かす火災として知られる。
sen.e: If nobody is around, this leads directly to the fire and this is known as the tenkasu fire.
If nobody is around, this leads directly to fire, and this is known as tenkasu fire.
If nobody is around, this leads directly to fire, and this is known as tenkasu fire.

sen.j: 天かすは空気（酸素）に触れる表面積が大きく油の酸化反応が早く進む。
sen.e: Since tenkasu has a large surface area exposed to the air (oxygen), it is easily-oxidizable.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Since tenkasu has a large surface area exposed to the air (oxygen), it is easily-oxidizable.
Since tenkasu has a large surface area exposed to the air (oxygen), it is easily-oxidizable.

sen.j: また反応熱は固まりの内部からは逃げにくいため、こもった熱によりさらに反応が加速され、温度が油の発火点を超えると発火する。
sen.e: Also, since the reaction heat hardly escapes from the piece, the trapped heat accelerates the reaction and takes fire when beyond the fire point of the oil.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Also, since the reaction heat hardly escapes from the piece, the trapped heat accelerates the reaction and takes fire when exceeding the fire point of the oil.
Also, since the reaction heat hardly escapes from the piece, the trapped heat accelerates the reaction and takes fire when exceeding the fire point of the oil.

sen.j: 大量の熱い天かすは平たい容器などに広げ、水をかけるなどして充分に冷却させてから処分する必要がある。
sen.e: The mass of warm tenkasu needs to be spread in the flat container or like that and watered to cool down before disposal.
The mass of warm tenkasu needs to be spread in a flat container or the like and watered to cool down before disposal.
The mass of warm tenkasu needs to be spread in a flat container or the like and watered to cool down before disposal.
